page.title: 14HEALTH - HARMSTON HALL HOSP.
page.content: This residential psychiatric hospital, centred on a Georgian mansion and park, is involved in a 1984-1994 programme under N. Lincs. Health Authority and Lincs. C.C. Social Services. Residents will move back into community care in their own localities. 100 patients have been moved and the present 300 beds will eventually be reduced to 60. {MEDICAL: }Present cover is given by full-time hospital doctors, including a consultant psychiatrist, and local GPs working weekly sessions, assisted by 255 nurses and student nurses. WRVS and others give social help. {EDUCATION: }The LEA Special School here expects to lose the 6 remaining children by March 1986. The present 24 adolescent pupils will move or become part of adult and peripatetic training schemes now being developed there.
